subject: Re: In JUnit 4.1, how do you tell the test runner to stop running tests?
msgSnippet: I was able to figure it out, and the secret was indeed in UserStopTest.java.  Here s some code to help out the next person. @BeforeClass public static void
messageBody:
I was able to figure it out, and the secret was indeed in
UserStopTest.java. Here's some code to help out the next person.

@BeforeClass
public static void runBeforeTestClass() throws Exception {
if(System.getProperty("someproperty") == null) {
RunNotifier fNotifier;
fNotifier= new RunNotifier();
fNotifier.pleaseStop();
fail("someproperty was not set!");
fNotifier.fireTestStarted(null);
}

}

If this is something you are likely to use in a number of places, you
can just take the notifier code, and put it in a stopRunner method
that takes in the string argument you want to show up in the fail
message. This works nicely as it is passed up and shows up in the
final html junitreport output.
